text: Does anyone know, if I rename a theme folder that pages are currently using, will it break them?

Hey,

I don't have enough information about this, but as I know, renaming the folder is not recommended as it could break things in a BIG way. Although, there is a blog on renaming a folder you can take a look
<https://blog.HubSpot.com/customers/how-to-fix-your-file-names-and-folder-structures>

Thanks, Vishal. Just tested it on a staged page with a cloned theme and it seems to be fine for my use-case. If youâ€™re using relative paths to the theme folder or files inside the folder, from outside the theme folder though, you will break things. Even when deleting the theme folder a page is using, HubSpot still seems to use the last working cached version and upon editing the page you receive:

I have an issue on my marketplace provider account to create child themes, I have already one child theme, but some account limits are not letting me create additional child themes <https://lpd-themes.d.pr/p6K9jg> ERROR: Cannot create more that 1 theme extension(s). Can anyone clarify my case?
